1113322.title: Golden Retriever

11133222.content:
In a big, wooden house, deep in the forests of Oregon, far from the noise and distractions of city life, there lived a boy named Oliver. This was a bittersweet time in Oliver’s life, as he was in the last semester of high school, and he was preparing to attend a university in another state. It was exciting in many ways, but there was one thing he wasn’t looking forward to; the fact that he would have to leave behind his hometown, and in turn, his family, for years at a time. Somehow, he knew he was going to miss his dog and his younger brother most of all…

“C’mon! Look at him, mom! He’s starving!” Oliver’s brother, Billy, complains, pointing to the family dog. “Can’t we just give him some treats?”

“Sorry, honey, but you know what the vet said. No treats until he loses all that weight,” their mother replies, while busily folding clothes. “You want him to be healthy, don’t you?”

Billy sighs. “Yeah… but I want him to be happy, too!”

Oliver looked up from his phone, gazing across the room at their golden, retriever, Rusty. Rusty’s always been a unique dog, grappling with two genetic disorders in particular; one that resulted in him being very tall, and another that resulted in him being constantly hungry, no matter how full he is. Thus, as you can imagine, he’s a big eater. Unable to resist his cute charm, the family spoiled him relentlessly, giving him all the treats his heart desired. He gained weight quickly, but most of it his weight gain was hidden beneath his long fur, so nobody noticed.

Now, though, Rusty was visibly on the heavy side. He didn’t have nearly as much energy as he used to; it took too much energy for him to lug his big, chubby body around, so he spent most of his days relaxing. He’s also become even more obsessed with food than ever. Still, the more weight he gained, the happier and cuter Rusty seemed to become, so the boys were content with the development. Their mother, however, brought the dog to a vet; and now, poor Rusty’s on a diet.

The diet seemed like a pointless endeavour, all things considered. Rusty was hardly even losing any weight. The only thing the diet seemed to accomplish was making him miserable all the time. The once cheerful dog now always had a sad look on his face, his ears drooping, occasionally letting out little sighs of woe. Seeing Rusty be miserable made Billy miserable… and in turn, seeing Billy miserable made Oliver miserable. Pondering the situation… Oliver got an idea.
11133222.title: Rusty the Retriever

choices: Go for a walk in the woods
Go for a swim at the lake
111332221.content:
The next day, Oliver decide to go out grocery shopping. Nominally, he was just out to get the essentials… but he also grabbed something extra along the way, and his parents were none the wiser. He stuffed most of the groceries in the fridge, but he snuck a strange, cardboard box upstairs with him without anyone noticing. “Hey, Billy! Could you come up here, dude? I need to show you something!” He called downstairs. He prepared his surprise as Billy ran up the stairs towards him.

“What’s up?” Billy asked, stepping into his brother’s room to find him tearing open an unmarked cardboard box. He watched curiously… only for Oliver to reveal that the box was full of dozens of raw beef patties!

“Rusty’s been looking hungry lately, huh?” Oliver said, smirking as he saw the shocked, excited look dawn on his brother’s face. “Don’t you think he’d like one of these?”

“Ohmygosh! Yes! Oh, this is going to make him so happy!” Billy immediately jumped to his feet, and ran over to the stairwell. “Rusty! Rusty! Come here, boy!” The golden retriever seemed hesitant to move… but eventually, at the boy’s goading, the canine dragged himself up the stairs. The scent of the patties, though, seemed to immediately put a spring in Rusty’s step! Oliver laughed as the golden retriever came bounding into the room, jumping on his hind legs and trying to grab at the box.

“Here, how about a treat for him?” Oliver said, handing Billy a patty. Billy was practically bouncing with excitement himself, so happy to finally be able to give the chubby, hungry dog a treat. Billy tossed the patty up in the air… and the golden retriever leaped up and caught it in his mouth! He clapped his jaws shut, and swallowed the patty in midair, the chunk of beef instantly sliding down his throat. The dog landed, licking his lips with satisfaction, glad to finally have some real food after substituting on dry kibble for so long.

Meanwhile, Billy was giggling wildly in joy. It made Oliver smile to see his brother so happy. “Another one! Another one!” Billy eagerly reached out a hand, gesturing for more patties.

“Okay, okay,” Oliver chuckled, handing over another patty. Billy tossed the patty across the room, and the boys laughed as the dog chased it and swallowed it in midair again. They repeated this a few times, until five patties were now resting in the dog’s gut, filling him up nicely.

“Give me three this time!” Billy said, reaching out a hand again.

“Uh, are you sure? I don’t think he should be eating this many…” Oliver said, starting to have hesitations. This box was supposed to last for months, but they’re already chewing through it at a startling rate.

“C’mon, look at him! He’s still so hungry!” He said, pointing at Rusty, who had a big, adorable doggy smile on his face as he eagerly awaited more patties. That face was difficult to resist.

“Okay, okay, a few more…” He said, handing three patties over. Oliver watched in surprise as Billy tossed them all at once… only for the dog to leap up and swallow all three in midair! The two boys watched in awe as a sizeable lump travelled down Rusty’s throat as he landed, before he let out a content sigh.

“Whooaa! That was awesome!” Billy cheered. “C’mon! Three more, three more!”

He knew it was a bad idea to keep feeding Rusty… but he was kind of enjoying watching him swallow the patties. “Alright, alright,” he said, handing three more patties to Billy and letting him toss them all, so they could watch Rusty swallow each patty in midair. For such a chubby dog, Rusty sure was agile. They repeated this a couple of time. Now, a total of 17 patties were filling Rusty’s stomach, giving him a visible paunch.

Billy looked over at the box, noticing it was still three fourths of the way full. “Y’know, we should just let him have the whole box!” He suggested, excitedly.

“W-what? No way! This is four month’s worth of patties!” Oliver replied. “We don’t want him to get too fat!”

“Well, why not? Getting fatter just makes him look even cuter!” Billy smiled. “Isn’t that right, boy?” He patted the golden on the head. Rusty licked his hands, hungry for more patties. Oliver sat there for a while, considering it. Sure, part of him did want to watch the dog stuff himself full… but his rational mind knew that that probably wasn’t the smartest idea. Besides, his mother would probably notice Rusty was so stuffed, and he’d get in big trouble for ruining his diet…

While Oliver was distracted, Billy suddenly grabbed the box out of his hands! “Hey! No! Don’t you d-” It was too late. Billy turned over the box, sending dozens of patties flying all over the room. Rusty swallowed six in midair, before landing and getting to work on the others, scooping multiple patties into his mouth with his tongue and gulping them all down. He ate at such an incredible rate, Oliver hardly had time to react! “Oh no! Rusty, stop!”

By the time Oliver reacted, only a single patty was left uneaten. Both boy and dog leaped for it, and while Oliver grabbed it first, Rusty wasn’t far behind. Rusty grabbed the patty with his powerful jaws and tried gulping it down, but Oliver wasn’t willing to let it go… even when his hand got pulled into the canine’s throat! “Rusty, no! Let go!” He tried his best to hold on to the patty, but the dog’s throat muscles were trying to tug it out of his hand. Still, feeling his fist so easily slide into the dog’s warm, wet throat gave him a strange feeling. With a groan, he let go off the patty, feeling it slide deeper into the dog’s throat, and then pulled his hand out of Rusty’s mouth to find it now covered with saliva. “Ugh…”

In just a few seconds, Rusty had swallowed over 60 raw beef patties! He let out a long, satisfied groan as he rolled over on his back. His huge, round stomach was now the size of a beach ball! The boys both stared at his huge, furry gut in awe… before Billy darted forward, and started giving the canine an enthusiastic belly rub! Rusty’s tail wagged happily as Billy rubbed his hands all over the distended gut, pressing his ear against its side to listen to the patties digesting within. For some reason, staring at the dog’s huge gut and thinking about all that food packed tightly within… Oliver was starting to get that funny feeling again. “Wow! This is awesome! I’ve never seen Rusty so full… or so happy!”

Billy looked over his shoulder. “C’mon, feel it!” Oliver hesitated… but the urge overwhelmed him. He reluctantly knelt down and pressed a hand against the dog’s gut, feeling the incredibly squishy, soft belly flesh. Rusty’s belly was now like a big pillow. Oliver pressed his ear up against it, and listened to the loud gurgling and churning within as Rusty’s stomach processed his huge meal. Oliver imagined what it must look like in the dog’s stomach, the patties pressed into a single mass by the tight stomach walls as he digests his feast.

This was all giving Oliver this weird feeling that was making him uncomfortable. He stood up, trying not to look at the dog’s belly, hoping that the feeling would just go away. “Alright, now Rusty’s not hungry anymore. Satisfied? Cause we’re definitely not doing this again,” he said. “Don’t let mom find out about this, alright?” With that, he walks downstairs, leaving Billy behind with Rusty. As he leaves, he can hear Billy still laughing and giggling as he gives the canine the best belly rub of all time.

Oliver crashed on the cough and pulled out his phone, trying to forget what he’d just seen. All he had to do now was hope that his mother didn’t find out what he’d done…

The rest of the afternoon, Rusty seemed to be very cheerful, walking around proudly with his big, round belly swaying beneath him. Somehow, their mother didn’t seem to notice. Oliver tried to ignore it, but he always found himself staring at the dog’s belly throughout the day, watching it gradually get smaller and smaller as the patties were digested. By that night, the dog’s belly had been reduced to a manageable paunch. Oliver could only shudder to imagine how much weight the dog was going to gain…

The next day was a saturday, meaning both boys were off of school. It was a beautiful, sunny day outside, and very warm by Oregon standards, making it a perfect day to enjoy the outdoors. Over breakfast, Oliver and Billy discussed how they should spend their morning...
111332221.title: Rusty's Big Meal!

1113322213.content:
For most of the year, there was a farmers market in town every saturday, and it was Oliver’s responsibility to head down there every week and do some needed shopping. Billy liked to tag along most of the time, just for fun. “I’ve got to be at the farmer’s market by noon. Better finish up breakfast quick if you want to come,” Oliver said.

“Oh! Can Rusty come?” Billy asked, excitedly. Oliver hesitated. Rusty was fairly well-trained, so he did occasionally allow him to come with them to the farmer’s market, but it was sort of a hassle. Still, the pleading look on his brother’s face was convincing. “Please please please please!”

Oliver chuckled. “Alright, alright. Rusty can come. But you have to keep an eye on him, alright?” Oliver said, and Billy nearly cheered. As if on cue, Rusty came padding into the room, well-rested after a good night’s slumber. The canine has already effectively processed his previous meal, and it seems he’s put on about 5 pounds over the course of a single night. The retriever’s body was just a little more jiggly than it was yesterday, and he had a few more tiny rolls of fat covering his belly and rump. The boys stared in wonder at the results of last night’s binge, as the canine walked happily over to his food bowl for breakfast. Luckily, the weight gain was subtle enough that their mother didn’t notice.

“Whoa! Look at him!” Billy whispered. “He’s already gotten a little fatter in one night! Isn’t it adorable? Imagine how fat he’d get if we fed him like that everyday?”

Oliver was taken aback. “Every day? Are you out of your mind? That’d be so unhealthy!” Oliver replied. “No, no. That binge last night was a one-time thing. From now on, Rusty’s going back on a diet.”

Billy seemed disappointed at this. Even Rusty seemed upset, whimpering as he looked up at you, pawing at your leg. “See? Look at Rusty! He wants to be big and chubby!” Billy giggles, leaning down and petting Rusty. “Don’t you, boy? You wanna be a big, squishy pup, huh? Yes you do! Yes you do!” Rusty pants happily in response. Meanwhile, Oliver just tries to ignore it. Of course, the idea of fattening up Rusty as much as they could was quite appealing… but he had to be the responsible one here. Rusty’s health came first and foremost.

Eventually, Oliver slipped on a light jacket while Billy put Rusty on a leash. Rusty’s collar only barely seemed to fit around his neck fat; if he gains any more weight, it just might pop off. With that thought in mind, Billy hopped into the back seat of the family car, and Oliver began driving them along the unpaved back roads of the countryside. Getting to town took about a half hour, so it was a decently long trip. As he drive, Oliver could hear his brother giggling and cooing as he rubbed Rusty’s now softer and more jiggly belly.

Eventually, they pull up to an outdoor farmers market on the outskirts of towns. A wide variety of pristine examples of crops and artisan goods were arranged in wooden stalls all around the market, and Billy loved trying to find unique fruits he hadn’t seen before. Meanwhile, Oliver concentrated on this week’s shopping list. While the two boys were distracted, Rusty was getting antsy, and he could feel his belly grumbling in hungry. That meal yesterday seemed to reawaken his appetite, and now he was hungrier than ever! He tried to stick by Billy’s side, but eventually, his primal urges overcame him. He flexed his fat neck, and his collar snapped right off!

The brothers both gasped in shock as the dog sprinted away at incredible speeds! “Rusty!” Billy gasps, clasping his hands over his mouth.

“No! Rusty! Get back here!” Oliver cried, chasing after the retriever. He ducked and weaved through the stalls of the farmers market, trying to keep up with the chubby canine. His heart was racing at this point, and he could tell he was humiliating himself in front of everybody at the market. Eventually, he caught up to Rusty… but what he saw froze him in shock.

Rusty was swallowing an entire watermelon! The dog’s jaws were spread incredibly wide as the golden retriever tipped his head back, taking big gulps and letting gravity help slide the watermelon down his throat. Soon, the watermelon was reduced to a huge bulge in Rusty’s neck. It continued travelling down his body, until it finally dropped into his stomach. The watermelon created a huge, round bulge in the canine’s gut. Oliver could only stand there, staring, as if in a trance… until the owner of the watermelon started yelling at him! “Hey! Get a hold of your dog, man!”

“Sorry! So sorry!” Oliver said, jumping back into action. He sprinted towards the dog, trying to grab him, but apparently, Rusty’s appetite hadn’t been sated yet, and thus the canine ran away again. “Rusty! Get back here right now!” The following chase was completely futile. The dog was just far too fast for Oliver to catch up. As the dog ran around the farmer’s market, he’d occasionaly stop to lick up some fruits and vegetables from somebody’s cart, and gulp them down whole. As this continued, Rusty’s belly slowly grew bigger and bigger, and the dog was slowed down considerably. Eventually, he was slow enough that Oliver was finally able to catch up to him.

Oliver grabbed Rusty, wrapping his arms around the dog and keeping him from escaping. “Bad dog! Bad dog! What has gotten into you?” Eventually, Rusty gives up and lies down on the ground, exhausted by his binge. Oliver was pretty tired from chasing the dog down, so he slowly rose to his feet… only to find himself staring into the eyes of the manager of the market!

“You’re going to pay for all the products your dog just ate, right?” The manager said.

Oliver sighs. “Of course.”

Oliver pays all the shop owners back for their lost products, before shoving Rusty back into the car. Both of the brothers seemed mortified by what had happened. Rusty, on the other hand, seemed satisfied. His big, round, fluffy belly was huge at this point, and he wagged his tail in satisfaction at the feeling of all the fruits and veggies churning around inside his gut. “C’mon, Oliver. Don’t be mad at Rusty. He doesn’t know any better!” Billy begs.

“Weren’t you supposed to be watching him?” Oliver asked, bitterly.

“His collar broke…” He whimpered. Oliver sighed. In addition to the cost of the food Rusty devoured, they were going to have to buy him a new collar. Great.

Later, all three of the stepped back into the house again. The two boys looked sadly up at their mother, returning empty-handed. “Oh? How did your little shopping trip go?” Their mother asked.

“Terrible! Rusty escaped from his collar and went on an eating frenzy!” You sighed, crashing on the cough. “I had to spend every dime I had paying those guys back for the stuff Rusty ate just so they didn’t ban us from the farmer’s market!”

“Oh, I’m sorry to hear that, dear. Don’t tear yourself up about it too much. Sometimes these sorts of things just happen,” his mother replies.

He sighs, his anger deflated. “Yeah, I know. It was just… really embarrassing, you know?”

“I understand,” his mother nods. “Hey. Why don’t the three of you go blow off some steam somewhere this weekend? Maybe some time away from home will make you feel better.”

The boys weren’t particularly in the mood to go anywhere, and Rusty was already stuffed to the brim with food, but still, their mother’s word was law. They were going to have to go somewhere… but where?
1113322213.title: Eating Rampage

11133222131.content:
Since they lived in the middle of a forest, it wasn’t unusual for the two brothers to decide to spend a weekend camping on a whim. It was a nice way to settle down and relax, and Oliver’s phone had wifi even out in the wilderness, so it’s not like he was missing out on any news. At this point, the process was routine for them; they’d drive out to the same old spot, spend an hour of two pitching their tent and preparing their campsite, and just spend the rest of their weekend in total relaxation. Rusty’s collar was broken now, of course, but he could usually be trusted not to run away. Usually.

Oliver set up a hammock on two nearby trees, bore hopping into it and lounging around, lazily browsing the internet with his phone. Meanwhile, Billy laughed and giggled as he played with Rusty, often giving the dog enthusiastic belly rubs. Now that he wasn’t as angry at Rusty anymore, Oliver had to admit, the canine’s belly was a sight to behold. It was taking Rusty a while to process all the vegetables he’d devoured, so his belly was still absolutely huge, squishy and rounded, to the point that it swayed to and fro beneath him as he walked. Oliver found himself staring at Rusty’s belly again, every so often, but he tried to resist the urge. He didn’t know why he liked the idea of a big, fat golden retriever so much. He was supposed to be the responsible one!

“Hey, Ollie! You think we can go fishing before it gets dark?” Billy called over to him. Oliver considering it for a while, before eventually flipped up out of the hammock.

“Uh, sure, yeah! Grab your gear!” They grabbed their fishing gear, and the two boys wandered down to the shore of the nearby river while Rusty followed slowly behind them, weighed down by his own belly. By the time Rusty made it to the shore, the two brothers were already set up, and Oliver was about to cast his line. “Alright, now watch how the real pros get things done.” He joked, before casting his line into the further depths of the lake. To his surprise, only a few seconds later, he felt something tugging on the end of the string! “Whoa! A bite already?”

Billy watched excitedly as Oliver started reeling his first catch in. Finally, the fishing line pulled a chinook salmon up from the water, and it flopped around futilely as Oliver grabbed it in his hands and carefully plucked the hook from its mouth. “Whoa! This thing is huge,” he said, showing it off to Billy.

“I wonder if Rusty can eat it!” Before Oliver can respond, Billy suddenly grabs the salmon from his hands. “Here, Rusty! Catch!” Oliver doesn’t react in time, and can only watch helplessly as his brother tosses his catch through the air towards the waiting canine. Rusty jumped up and caught the fish halfway in his mouth in midair. When he landed, the fish’s long, flailing tail was the only thing hanging from the dog’s jaws… until he leaned back his head and swallowed, and that, too, disappeared. Oliver felt that funny feeling course through him stronger than ever as he watched the huge bulge travel down Rusty’s furry throat, down into his already bloated belly.

Oliver wanted to act upset that Billy had stolen the fish from him, but he was too stunned to say a word. He thinks he’s totally on board with the whole ‘fattening Rusty’ thing now. Meanwhile, Billy is as excited as ever to watch Rusty get even pudgier. “Oh! Let me try to catch one!” Billy said, excitedly casting his line. Just like before, it only took a few seconds for a fish to take the bait and start tugging on his line. “Oh! The fish are really active today!” Billy reeled in a large steelhead, and soon, that, too, was sent flying down Rusty’s throat.

“C’mon! Aren’t you going to help?” Billy asked, casting his line again. Oliver knew, on a rational level, that it would probably be a bad idea to stuff Rusty any further… but watching the dog gulp down his meals was just too invigorating. Oliver quickly caught another fish, and hesitantly tossing it over to Rusty, watching the dog catch it and instantly send it sliding down his throat. Soon, both brothers were catching fish after fish at an incredible rate, and tossing them over to Rusty. The canine always seemed hungry for more, no matter how incredibly full he was getting.

Eventually, the sun had set, and they decided it was time to head home. Now that they got a good luck at Rusty, they realized they might have overdone it a little bit. The dog’s belly was already huge before, but now, it was twice that size! Rusty’s belly was almost as big as the golden retriever himself. His belly was so big, Rusty was completely immobilized, unable to walk by himself. Despite this, the canine seemed happier than ever, panting and wagging his tail in excitement. “Uh, we might’ve fed Rusty a little too much, in hindsight…” The two of you start slowly pushing the dog back towards camp. “C’mon, boy. Let’s go get some shut-eye…”

That night, the three sit around the campfire, the boys chatting and having dinner. Billy idly rubs Rusty’s huge belly as he eats, occasionally slipping some left-over foot to the dog, which the canine happily accepts. “He’s STILL hungry? His belly’s almost as big as his whole body!” Oliver asks, blown away by the golden retriever’s gluttony. “Man, what is up with Rusty’s appetite recently? He’s out of control.”

“Oh, come on. Mom’s been keeping him on that crazy diet for months. I’m sure he’s been super hungry,” Billy laughed, patting Rusty on the gut and hearing it gurgle.

Later still, the three of them settled down in their tent for the night, ready to get some shut-eye. Rusty huffed as he settled in beside Billy, and Billy immediately started cuddling against the dog’s immense, soft, pillowy belly. “Oh my gosh… he’s so comfy…” Rusty’s belly was almost as big as he was! Billy couldn’t even wrap his arms all around it as he hugged Rusty close, using the dog’s belly like a huge, comfy pillow as he got ready to fall asleep. Oliver tried to ignore the spectacle, although secretly, he envied Billy. What he wouldn’t give to snuggle up with a huge, fluffy belly like that…

The next morning, Oliver woke up in his sleeping bag, sitting up and stretching with a yawn. He stepped sleepily out of the tent to find Billy and Rusty sitting around the fire, with Billy happily cooking breakfast. Oliver couldn’t help but notice something, though; Rusty had gained a TON of weight overnight! About fifteen pounds! His belly, sides and rump have now been consumed by folds of fat which jiggled visibly as he walked around, and he always seemed to be panting in exertion. Still, the retriever somehow managed to still walk at a decent pace, though he was a bit sluggish now.

Billy notices Oliver standing there, staring at Rusty’s new, obese form. “I know, right? Isn’t he absolutely adorable now?” Billy smiled, patting Rusty on the head. Olver shakily took a seat across from Billy, and tried to continue his morning as if everything was normal, though he just couldn’t stop staring at the canine and watching his pudge jiggle with his every movement…

Little did they know, a threat was sneaking up on them, hidden in the bushes of the forest. They were all being stalked by a...
11133222131.title: Gone Fishing

111332221312.content:
Hidden in the bushes around the campsite, a small pack of coyotes was silently creeping, determining whether or not they should strike. They were all downwind of the camp, so they were difficult to detect… but eventually, Rusty starts to notice something. He sits up quickly, staring off into the distance and growling, as if ready to spring into the bushes at any moment. “Rusty? What’s wrong, boy?” Billy asked, patting him on the head. The golden retriever seemed downright angry at something. It was rare to see him like this. The two boys stared into the bushes, trying to spot whatever Rusty was growling at.

Soon, Oliver noticed a tail peeking out over the bushes. He squinted, and noticed even more of the canines lying in wait. His blood ran cold, and he grabbed Billy by the shoulder. “Coyotes. Lots of them.”

“Are they going to attack us?” Billy asked, starting to get scared. Coyotes don’t usually attack humans, but these ones seemed odd…

“I don’t know. They look hungry…” Oliver said, slowly backing away. Rusty heroically planted himself inbetween the brothers and the coyotes, growling and snarling, ready to defend the humans.

“Rusty! Be careful!I” Billy called. Their hearts were racing as the coyotes slowly emerged from the bushes, snarling hungrily. Rusty was hopelessly outnumbered, and yet, the golden retriever was still unafraid. The brothers could only watch helplessly and hold their breaths as Rusty leaped forward!
111332221312.title: Surrounded

choices: A ton of scrumptious dog treats
1113322213122.content:
Vore Warning!

Time seems to stand still for a moment as Rusty goes soaring through the air, with incredible speed for such a chubby canine. The coyotes try to flee, but they can’t all make it in time, and one of them gets landed on by the huge pooch. The coyote’s yelp is muffled as its head is instantly enveloped by Rusty’s huge jaws, which squeeze down tightly around it. The two brothers can only watch as the coyote tries desperately to back away, apparently strong enough to drag Rusty around the glade but still unable to free its head from the vice grip of the dog’s mouth.

Both the brothers and the other coyotes were watching in awe, frozen in place. Eventually, the trapped coyote wears itself out in its attempts to break free, and Rusty manages to wrestle it to the ground. Seizing the opportunity, Rusty laid down on the coyote’s torso, pinning it down beneath his huge, pudgy body! The other coyotes looked like they wanted to rescue their comrade, but they were too afraid of suffering the same fate. The spectators could only watch as the dog takes a big gulp, swallowing the coyote’s head into his throat.

The coyote was quite a few inches smaller and lighter than Rusty, but still, swallowing the squirming carnivore whole was no easy feat. The largest thing Rusty’s swallowed was a watermelon, and this coyote was not only larger, but also actively resisting. Still, the golden retriever was able to stretch his jaws around him with incredible ease. Soon, Rusty stood up to reveal the coyote was now halfway down his throat, its legs kicking futilely as it was drawn further in. Upon seeing this, the rest of the coyotes seemed frightened, and fleed into the bushes, leaving their comrade behind.

The two brothers watched in stunned silence as Rusty tilted his head back, letting gravity assist the coyote’s descent down his throat. Each gulp brought the coyote a few more inches in, added to the huge, visibly moving bulge in the front of Rusty’s throat. Eventually, the coyote’s legs were forcibly straightened out as they descended into the dog’s gullet, before Rusty finally clapped his jaws shut, licking his lips with satisfaction as he finally finished off his meal. The two were dumbstruck as the coyote was reduced to a huge, round bulge in their dog’s tight gut. Eventually, Billy was the first to speak.

“Whoa! That was the coolest thing I’ve ever seen!” The boy jumped forward excitedly, running up to their triumphant pooch. He immediately started hugging and petting Rusty, who panted and barked happily, his tail wagging. “Rusty! You saved us, buddy!” Rusty rolled over onto his back, and Billy happily rubbed his hands over the dog’s huge belly, rewarding him for his heroism. Meanwhile, Oliver stepped cautiously forward, unable to pry his eyes away from the dog’s huge, fluffy gut. It was like he was in a trance. That funny feeling returned to him again in full force.

“Is it really… still alive in there?” Oliver asked, his voice shaky.

“Yep! Feel it!” Billy gestured over to him. Hesitantly, Oliver stepped forward, kneeled down and pressed his hands up against the firm skin of Rusty’s belly, feeling the coyote moving around within. There are visible bulges in the golden retriever’s gut as the coyote tries to break free, but these only seem to satisfy the golden further. Watching Rusty swallow those fish had been exciting, but this… well, this was on a whole nother level. Oliver had to turn and walk away to cool off, disturbed by the feelings this was giving him. He couldn’t be… getting off on this, could he?

Soon, the coyote passes out due to the lack of air within Rusty’s gut, and his belly goes still. It’s still absolutely gigantic, though, and drags along the ground beneath him as he walks, forcing him to waddle slowly around. Oliver tries his best not to stare or think about what had happened. “Let’s pack up and go home. I think that’s enough camping for one weekend,” he said. While Rusty relaxed in the cool car and got to work digesting his meal, the two brothers starting tearing down their camp, before Oliver drove them all back home.

“Oh, good morning, sweethearts! Did you enjoy your camping trip?” Their mother asked when they walked in. She was distracted, though, when Rusty waddled in behind them. “Whoa! What happened to Rusty? He’s supposed to be on a diet!”

“Rusty saved our lives, mom!” Billy said excitedly. “There was a big pack of coyotes out there about to eat us, but Rusty gobbled one of them up and scared them all away!”

“Is that so? Well, I’ll be. Good boy, Rusty,” she smiles, kneeling down and patting Rusty on the head. “Now, you boys shouldn’t be camping when there’s a pack of coyotes running around. I’ll call the sheriff's department and see if anyone can take of that. In the meanwhile…” She taps her chin. “I think Rusty’s earned a big, delicious lunch!” Rusty perked up, his tail wagging at this.

“You want to feed him more food?” Oliver gawked. “Isn’t he supposed to be on a diet?”

“Well, yes, but… he saved your lives! I think he deserves to binge,” she smiles. After lunch, the family piles into the car, and their mother drives them downtown, ready to shop for a reward for Rusty.

Rusty did save their lives, so he did deserve a big feast, after all. What kind of feast were they going to get him, though?
1113322213122.title: Coyote Snack!

11133222131222.content:
They stopped at the nearest pet store, and Billy insisted they buy all the tastiest treats they could. Their mother was a little hesitant, but at Billy’s behest, and with Oliver’s offer to chip in, she ultimately spared no expense, purchasing a feast fit for a dozen dogs. They returned home carrying half a dozen bags, stuffed to the brim with delicious treats that delighted Rusty’s nostrils. He immediately started jumping up and down with excitement, sniffing and pawing at the bags. “Calm down, boy! Give us a second! Don’t worry, you’ll have all the treats you can eat soon!” Oliver said.

While Rusty hungrily licked his lips, they arranged the treats they’d bought for him on a tray. In total, they’d purchased; 1 huge ten-pound peanut butter cake designed to be safe for dogs, 12 cupcakes covered and stuff with small dog treats, and an uncountable number of those little bone-shaped, bacon-flavored dog treats. Even though his belly was already huge, Rusty’s appetite seemed limitless, and he was totally ready to devour his huge meal. “Think of this as a ‘thanks for saving our lives’ gift, boy!” Billy smiled, as he did the honor of setting the tray down on the floor.

The three stepped back and watched in awe as the dog immediately got to work chowing down. He immediately took out a sizeable chunk of the cake with his huge jaws, gulping down the chunk before taking another. That cake alone could’ve fed 10 dogs, and he was devouring it in a matter of seconds! Now that their mother had a good look at his eating habits, she could tell how he managed to devour that coyote. In only a couple of minutes, the entire 10-pound cake was completely gone, and his belly was now so huge it was pressed against the floor. Still, Rusty kept eating, his appetite insatiable.

Oliver and his mother stared on in awe and horror, knowing they should probably stop the retriever’s binge but being too fascinated to interfere. On the other hand, Billy was excitedly cheering him on, smiling as he watched the dog’s belly grow bigger and bigger every second. Once the cake was done, Rusty started swallowing each of the cupcakes whole one by one. By this point, the dog’s belly was bigger than the rest of his entire body, and Rusty was immobilized by the sheer mass of what he’s eaten. Still, he continued. Once he was done with the cupcakes, he started shoveling huge amounts of the smaller treats into his mouth until his cheeks bulged with them, before swallowing them en masse.

A few minutes later, the family had to roll him into the living room. His belly was just that huge, at that point. “Wow! I knew he had an appetite, but… just, wow. I hope this doesn’t mess up his diet too much,” their mother said.

“I know, right? This is amazing!” Billy said, hugging Rusty’s gut. The dog’s belly was now even bigger than he was. “You’ve got a big, squishy belly, don’t you boy? Yes you do! Yes you do!” Billy suddenly gets an idea, and oliver’s eyes widen in surprise as his brother climbs up on top of Rusty’s huge belly!

“Hey! Billy! What are you doing?” Oliver says.

“I’m gonna see how bouncy it is!” Billy laughed, as he shakily stands up on the dog’s gut. Once he’s balanced, he hops into the air slightly, and indeed, starts bouncing up and down on Rusty’s jiggling belly as if it was a miniature trampoline. “Whoa! This is awesome!” Billy was giggling uncontrollably as he bounced up and down slightly on the canine’s gut.

“Be careful! You’re gonna hurt him!” Oliver protests.

“No I’m not! Look at him, he loves it!” Indeed, Rusty was panting and wagging his tail happily, apparently enjoying the sensation of Billy hopping up and down on his gut. The boy had always been rather scrawny, so his bouncing didn’t harm the retriever; in fact, it helped Rusty digest his huge meal. Oliver sighs, deciding to just let him have his fun. He lies on the cough, fiddling with his phone again… but he can’t help but stare. Rusty’s belly was absolutely huge; even bigger than Billy himself! Oliver couldn’t help but wonder how it was even possible for Rusty’s gut to stretch that big. He shuddered at the thought, turning back to his phone.

Eventually, night time rolled around, and it was time for the brothers to return to bed. They had school tomorrow. Rusty’s belly was so huge, he couldn’t even move, so he and Billy just spent the night sleeping on the floor of the living room, Billy using the dog’s belly as a pillow again. Meanwhile, Oliver retreated to his room upstairs, carefully locking the door behind him. Now that he had some alone time, the young man was ready to finally release some of the ‘tension’ he worked up during that camping trip. Thus, he slid off his pants and curled up in bed with his laptop.

He went to type something into the search bar, but his mind drew a blank. He wasn’t really in the mood for porn, necessarily. In fact… all he could think about were the events of that camping trip. Secretly, Oliver had always had a fetish for weight gain and stuffing, but he never thought that ‘interest’ would cross over to dogs, of all things. But he had to admit, something about watching Rusty get so incredibly full, and gain so much weight so quickly, was exhilarating. Especially watching him swallow down that coyote. Thus, he reluctantly googled ‘dog fattening’ - out of pure morbid interest, or so he told himself.

He clicked on the first website that popped up - poochpudge.com. Oliver was taken aback as he was immediately presented with an image of the fattest labrador he’s ever seen. That thing looked like a walking tank of pudge! It had to be at least 200 pounds! Stunned, he continued exploring the site. Apparently, ‘poochpudge’ was split into two sections - a rudimentary gallery, and a forum. The gallery seemed to be composed of hundreds of images and videos of either chubby, jiggling dogs playing around, or skinny dogs eating a ton of food and gaining weight. It seemed sort of weird, but the dogs all seemed to be super happy, so Oliver guessed there wasn’t anything wrong with it.

Then, he moved onto the forums. At first glance, it seemed to be just a regular community for a bunch of people who are, for some reason, really big fans of fat dogs. However, when Oliver investigated deeper, he noticed some interesting things. First of all, there is apparently a rare and very popular type of dogs the forums call ‘gulpers’, who have endless appetites and swallow all their food whole, regardless of how large it is. That explains Rusty’s behavior at least. Oliver also learns that the site had a hidden 18+ section in the gallery, which you had to message an admin and specifically request access for. He shuddered to even imagine what might lie inside.

Pushing that thought from his mind, he dwelled through the gallery for a while, finding a few videos that interested him. He was blown away by just how fat some of these dogs were capable of getting. Was Rusty going to look like that soon, at this rate? He could hardly even imagine. For some reason, watching all those furry folds of fat jiggle was enticing to Oliver, and he found his hand slowly drifting between his legs. He had to blow off steam somehow, after all…

About a half hour later, when Oliver is finished, he drifts off to sleep, ready to face the next day...
11133222131222.title: Big Dinner

111332221312221.content:
The next morning, Oliver gets ready just like he always does, trying to forget about the events of the previous night. But the shame, and the arousal, still follow him. Part of him regretted every visiting that site, and the other part was desperate to go back again. The dogs in the gallery he thought about the most were the Gulpers. Rusty’s skills were impressive, but the larger dogs were able to swallow incredibly huge meals all at once, to the point that Oliver wondered what their limits were. Apparently, though, all videos of Gulpers devouring other animals were restricted to the 18+ section of the gallery, which almost tempted Oliver to request entry. One though plagued his mind; was it even possible for one of those Gulpers to swallow, say, a whole person? Discussion of that possibility seemed to be restricted to the 18+ section as well, leaving him frustrated...

Sitting on the couch, Oliver idly chuckles as Rusty licks at his feet, covering them with slobber and almost drawing them into his maw. Seeing just how huge the dog was, and how wide his mouth could stretch, he can’t help but wonder whether Rusty might be capable of swallowing him whole, just as he had that coyote. He had seen the retriever stuff its belly even larger before, so he was sure he would fit. What would Oliver do in such a situation, he wondered? Would he try to pull himself free from the dog's slobbering maw, before it was too late? Or would he just allow himself be pulled inch by inch down Rusty's throat, and into the dog's big, fluffy belly? Honestly... he couldn't say for sure.

Not like that would ever happen, anyway. Rusty’s protective instinct is too strong, there’s no way he would hurt him. Perhaps if he slathered himself in peanut butter, Rusty would think he’s just a big tasty treat? Oliver grows excited at the very thought, and he resolves to try his idea at the soonest possible opportunity… wait, what was he thinking!? Even if it was possible, he can’t feed himself to the family pet! That was insane! As if waking up from a trance, he stands up, awkwardly hiding the tent in his pants as he hurries for the door. That website he had read last night must’ve been messing with his mind, making him think things he shouldn’t. He resolves not to go back on that site anymore, from now on.

Oliver drove to school, and tried not to let what he had seen distract him, though this proved difficult. It was hard to shake these new thoughts from his head. He could hardly focus all day, and when he finally returned that afternoon, he was frustrated and exhausted. Billy, meanwhile, was as happy and energetic as always, happy to see Rusty again and feed him a few more treats.The dog had gained a ton of weight since yesterday, of course, probably about 20 pounds. Rusty’s entire body jiggled with every step, which seemed to slow him down significantly, and still, the canine only seemed happier than ever. Oliver huffed, trying not to stare.

Now, how were they going to spend the rest of their afternoon?
111332221312221.title: Temptation

1113324.content:
The Dukey (Johnny Test)

Other Breeds
1113324.title: More breeds!

11133242.content: Maybe instead of just one dog, you work at a doggy-daycare for all sorts of pudgy male dogs?
11133242.title: Multiple Dogs?

choices: You had to give the dogs breakfast!
Somebody keeps sneaking in to pet the dogs!
111332421.content:
Among pet owners, dogs have been making a resurgence, and have been getting more and more popular... and in the eyes of the pet food companies, this was a golden opportunity! They launched a massive campaign to make people believe that it was actually healthy for dogs to be fed as much food as possible, even rewriting the rules in many dog competitions to make fatness qualify as more beautiful. Even some movies ended up featuring characters having fat dogs, always making a point of demonstration how happy all the fatness made them. This campaign quickly became a roaring success, and all throughout America, dog owners were buying tons of dog food to make their pooches as big as possible!

But there was a catch; something that the dog food companies didn't want people to know. The more dogs were fed, and the bigger they became, the more gluttonous and voracious they became! There became more and more reports of bigger dogs swallowing squirrels whole... and then cats... and then smaller dogs... and then, eventually, even young children!

You've only seen that last one once yourself. You were at the park when you noticed, in the distance, a huge fat mastiff being walked by his trainer, licking all over the face of a giggly young boy. You just chuckled at that, looking away... but when you looked back, there was only a small pair of feet sticking from the dog's mouth! The dog tried to stop him, but it was too late... the mastiff easily swallowed the young boy whole, in one gulp! The owner was obviously embarrassed by this, apologizing to the other people in the park for his carelessness. However, the mastiff seemed to be absolutely delighted, its tail wagging in bliss as his owner walked him home to let him relax and digest his squirming meal.

You had been mesmerized by the sight, and you couldn't figure out why you always thought about it... until recently. The truth was, the size of these dogs, and their sheer appetites... you found it very, very attractive for some reason! Which made your new job very awkward. You had just gotten hired as an employee of a doggy daycare, and your main job was to keep the many dogs there fed, while keeping them from eating eachother, or other things they couldn't. You tried to keep your feelings to yourself, but seeing how big and fat all these canines were... it could be a little overwhelming!

When you started your shift this morning, you already ran into a problem.
111332421.title: Doggy Daycare! (vore)

choices: You let him stay and help
1113324212.content:
You were just about to start your shift for the morning... only to walk past the back door, and pause at the familiar sound of giggling. You sigh, recognizing it immediately. There was some young boy around the neighborhood named Felix who always seemed to want to sneak into the outdoor pen, just to pet all the big dogs, despite you repeatedly warning him of the dangers of being around such gluttons! As you walked out the back door to deal with this, you were struck by a bit of a pang of panic when you noticed that he was with Boris!

Boris was a huge german shepherd, probably the biggest and most gluttonous dog in the entire daycare, with a huge, round, fluffy gut that almost drags along the floor. Boris was the one who most often could be found swallowing squirrels and stray cats and such, and he had to be kept away from the smaller dogs. And right now, Boris was laying atop the boy, Felix's torso underneath his belly, happily licking his face and slobbering all over it while Felix giggled. "Felix!" You immediately shouted as you trot up to him, interrupting their fun. "How many times do I have to tell you not to sneak in here?"

Indeed, you could tell that Boris had been getting hungrier and hungrier as he slobbered over his meal, probably gearing up to gobble him up! It was lucky that you happened to come around in town. You pulled Felix out from under his gut, at which Boris huffed, seeming disappointed. Felix, of course, was obviously disappointed, too. "Awww! I just wanted to pet him!" He pouted, crossing his arms. "What's the harm in that?"

You sigh, laying a hand on his shoulder. "Felix, as I've warned you, dogs this size can get very, very gluttonous!" You say. "A dog Boris' size could swallow you in one bite!"

"Well, what's wrong with that?" He complained, patting the side of Boris' huge gut. "His belly seems soft and comfy to me."

"When you're on the outside perhaps. But not when you're inside getting digested!" You chide him, and he stomps his foot, begrudgingly seeing your point despite his stubbornness.

"Well... now that you're here, maybe I can help you take care of him and the dogs?" He says. "I promise I won't sneak in anymore if you would just let me help!" You sigh, considering his offer. It's not the worst idea... as long as you're supervising, it should be pretty safe, right?
1113324212.title: Somebody keeps sneaking in to pet the dogs!

113.content: Shall we follow the story of Red? A chestnut stallion standing 15 hands tall who does obstacle courses? Or some other horse?
113.title: Horse

1131.content:
"Up!" Anne called to Red, who managed to jump the hurdle just in time so that he didn't hit the last hurdle on the makeshift obstacle course that Anne had made for him. The course consisted of a few rough beams on hay bales that counted for "hurdles" of various heights, poles that Red would weave himself through, and a small pit that he would have to leap over. The whole course was about 500 yards by 500 yards, not very large or complex, but enough to give a mental stimulus to Red, whom Anne had ridden since he was a year old.
         Red's master, Anne's father, had bought Red on a near whim for his daughter, who had managed to train and ride Red most aptly. The horse was expensive, but he didn't mind. They were rich enough to live comfortably enough with the horse. But Rick, Anne's father, couldn't seem to get rid of the horse; his daughter was going to college, but was sentimentally attached to Red. But Anne was going to college.
         "Annie, please," Rick had pled with his daughter, "let me please give Red away. You know that I'm too heavy to ride him," Rick shook his flabby stomach, soft from years of caloric, greasy southern food and too little exercise, for emphasis. Rick didn't care enough to lose it, and he didn't have the time nor the discipline to do it. "And he'll go nuts without you." Anne wouldn't be persuaded. She still argued that she would ride Red every weekend and every weekday she was able. Rick would always walk away incredulous that his daughter would actually do as she said. She had a habit of not doing so. But with Red, she had maintained interest for years, so Rick was reluctant to disbelieve his daughter.
         And so Anne went off to college, leaving Red behind. On the first day Red was not exercised, he fumed about his pen, whinnying furiously. Rick tried to calm him by petting him, by calling to him, and even by trying to ride him, but when Red started panting after one circuit on the obstacle course with Rick on him, Rick decided to not do that again. The second night it happened again. And having no other way of soothing Red, Rick gave him an extra scoop of oats.
         Anne came back to ride Red one day, but her ride was cut short by what to Red felt like a buzz coming from Anne's leg. Red had no idea what a cell phone was, but he knew that that buzz meant that Anne would ride him no longer. And Anne lost a phone once to Red in that way. And for a while, every five or six days, Anne would come back to ride Red. But that only happened for a month or two. Then, Anne would come every thirteen or fourteen days. Then, every thirty. By Christmas, Anne hadn't been home in a month; and when Red first heard Anne, he started prancing up and down like a foal.
         Anne came running over to Red, and the stallion stood at his gate eagerly awaiting the return of his favorite person in the world. She threw he bag in Red's storage shed, grabbed his equipment, and tried to put it on Red. "Why, Red, you must've grown some since I left," she laughed, readjusted his saddle, and rode him to the obstacle course. Red started, clearing the first hurdle with ease, but the second hurdle nearly scraped the bottom of his chest. The poles were no easier: Red tried to weave, but found that it hurt his flanks to do so.
         And panting for breath, he only bared cleared the pond and crashed into the final hurdle, leaving a mark on his chest. Catching his breath, Anne chuckled, "I'm sorry, Red, you must be unfamiliar with the course. I'm sorry I haven't ridden you in so long." She trotted Red over to the pasture, poured two liberal scoops of oats into Red's bucket, and watched him hungrily devour them.
1131.title: Follow Red's story.

11311.content:
Red soon learned that whinnying would earn him food, but only once every so often. But Rick, with increasing desire to not have Red whinny at him every half an hour, hoped that by giving Red more food, he would shut up the horse. Anne came again for spring break and tried to ride Red, who, this time, could barely manage to leap the second hurdle. Anne felt sorry for Red and gave him more oats to compensate for her own negligence.
         Becming increasingly bored, Red managed to wheedle out more food from Rick. Red also found that grass would occasionally allay his hunger, but not for as long as the oats would. For a while, Rick's plan for getting Red to stop whinnying worked, but eventually and periodically, he would have to increase the amount of oats he fed Red, from one scoop to one and a half, to two, to two and a quarter, slowly until he was giving Red three scoops of oats to Red every five or six hours during the day.
         The consequences on Red's waistline were swift and relatively dramatic. Red went from being a defintively toned and muscled agility horse to a soft, round butterball. After a few months, Red stopped prancing up and down and merely whinnied to have Rick feed him. Anne came again after a couple of months of being away and tried to ride Red on the obstacle course. Red barely made his way over the first hurdle before giving up. Anne again felt pity on him and filled his bucket full with oats and gave him a new incredibly sweet pastry that Red devoured.
         Rick one day noticed Red trying to run. It was a clumsy run that made Red tired after only 30 seconds. Rick walked over and habitually fed Red a liberal three and a quarter scoops of oats before he absentmindedly went back to work. The last time Anne ever rode Red on the obstacle course that she made, Red couldn't even jump the first hurdle. He hit it and hurt his leg, an injury that caused him to lie down for a couple of weeks to recuperate.
         Red didn't see the rural veteriarian very often because Rick didn't own a horse trailer, and he found it a pain to borrow one. But today, Rick managed to procure a horse trailer and an appointment to the vet's office. Red apparently needed some shots, required by law. So Rick attached the trailer to his truck, enticed Red in with a honey bun, and drove to the vet's office.
11311.title: Continue with the story.

113111.content:
Of course Rick couldn't be bothered to take multiple trips to the vet; so when he went, he took his dog as well. Red had never seen the dog before, but it looked rather strange, deformed almost. Red couldn't put his finger on what seemed odd about the dog, but he knew something was off. Perhaps it was the dog's torso, which looked like a ripe, swollen pear when the dog sat down after only having walked a few feet to the car. Red decided that it was the dog's abdomen that looked odd; otherwise, the dog looked like a normal Golden Retriever.
         Red watched with mild amusement as the dog struggled to get into the truck. Red faintly heard the words, "Hosea," whom he inferred to be the dog, "you,"' and "diet." Red somehow sensed that that wasn't going to happen, but he said nothing. Finally, it was his turn to get into the horse-trailer, which, to Red, was small and cramped, his flanks barely managed to fit into the trailer's stall.
         The ride was uncomfortable. The road was bumpy, twisted, and rapidly changed speeds, which jostled Red around. Of course, Rick seemed to have forgotten about his dog's diet when he stopped at some restaurant and, Red noticed, fed Hosea an entire pack of chicken nuggets. Eventually, the trio managed to get to the vet's office. Red was left in the trailer while Rick walked and Hosea did little better than a waddle in side.
         About half an hour later, Rick came out with Hosea, looking annoyed and tired with a veterianarian. The man took one look at Red and said to Rick, "Jeez, Rick, you really need to watch what you feed your animals. Your horse, like your dog, is obese. Feed him fewer oats and muzzle him some of the time so that he can't graze." After doing a few tests and giving a few shots, the vet left Rick fuming and spluttering, "Red, obese? I don't, I won't believe it."
         After he calmed down, he whispered to Red, "Don't worry, buddy; I don't think you're fat. I think that even if you are, we'll get you in shape in no time. You and Hosea both."
113111.title: The Vet Visit

1131111.content:
Far earlier than Red was accustomed to, Rick woke Red by his approaching footsteps. Red was at first startled before he smelled Rick and Hosea, who was panting already at the effort of walking down to Red's pasture. Rick found Red's old saddle, tried to fit it on, and realized that even the most loose setting wouldn't cinch around Red's stomach. Rick ran his hand down Red's back. He should hav been able to easily feel ribs, not see, but feel. With a dog, he reckoned, one wasn't supposed to feel any trace of ribs whatsoever; but with a horse, the ribs should be detectable, but not visible. Rick couldn't feel anything resembling a rib on Red's back.
         Red was definitely overweight, Rick thought to himself. But so were he and Hosea, Rick then thought to himself. Rick then put the lead, bridle, and bit on Red and led his horse and his dog for a walk. Red was almost immediately worried by Hosea. The poor dog was panting after only five or so minutes of the walk. His breathing was becoming more belabored by the second until he suddenly just flopped. Hosea just lay down on the grass, panted, and refused to get up. Rick didn't have the strength to force Hosea either. Rick's back and knees were such that that kind of exertion would have been excruciating for him. So the only solution was to sit and wait for the dog to recuperate and continue.
         Eventually, Hosea stood and managed to arduously make his way back to the house. Rick was overcome by pity for his dog, so that was the last time Red ever saw Hosea on a walk. Rick still went with Red every day, and the two even managed to lose some weight together. It was summer, and Red's fat acted as an insulator for body heat. Rick would occasionally bring Hosea out to the pasture and spray Red and Hosea with a hose to cool them off. Hosea could barely make his way to the pasture at that point, and couldn't get into Rick's truck without Rick's help. Red fel, at the same time, happy and sad for Hosea, happy because Hosea had attained a level of prosperity that his ancestors had never been able to achieve, and sad because of the maladies which afflicted Hosea because of this prosperity.          Eventually, however, Rick became busy again and slowly, as his daughter had, stopped coming to do anything with Red but feed and brush him, activities that Red liked, but not as much as a brisk walk through the farm. Red watched Rick's form slowly fill out again, perhaps more so than before he had tried to lose weight. Red also slowly felt his body add the soft pounds of flesh onto his own body. He could have chosen to stop eating, but he could never muster the willpower to stop.
         Hosea never came over to Red's pasture again that summer. Red smorted at the preposterous idea that Hosea had become too fat to move more than a few feet at a time, but somehow, that's what Red suspected had happened.
1131111.title: Continue with the story.

11311111.content: One day Rick walked over to Red and he saw the man crying. Red herd that Horsea died because of his weight. Did Rick make Red lose weight?
11311111.title: Continue

121.content: What breed would you like? A Golden Retriever, perhaps? What about a German Shepherd? Or do you have another breed in mind?
121.title: Dog

choices: Do you have any other options?
1211.content:
We have a wonderful selection of Golden Retrievers, so feel free to come on in and meet our lovely gals.

Molly: Molly is a hyperactive, lovable goof of a Golden. She just turned one this past month, and she's a gorgeous example of just how beautiful this breed can be. She's friendly, outgoing, and intensely curious, and she has one serious toy drive. She can be a bit intense at times, but she's an all-around good-natured gal who will really benefit from someone who can keep her busy. She isn't a troublemaker, but her high energy can sometimes get her into trouble. She's a wonderful dog, but she needs someone who knows how to handle her.

Molly has a long, flowing coat that's intensely red and golden, giving her quite the presence wherever she goes. Her dark brown eyes are full of excitement and wonder, and it seems as if she constantly has a smile on her muzzle. She's solidly built, a little on the large side for a female, but she's aware of her size and does a good job of not knocking over all the smaller children who always want to come and see her when she's out and about.

Molly is a big girl, but she's still trim and lean. You'll need to keep an eye on her diet, though. Molly won't go looking for food on her own, but she will eat anything you give to her, so make sure you keep track of how much you feed her; we've already had to put her on a diet once before.

Lexi: Lexi is a bit of an older gal, but she's still got lots of energy and will make a wonderful companion. She's about six years old, so she isn't a pup, but she's still a healthy gal with a big heart. She's gentle, quiet, and lovable; the kind of gal who'd enjoy getting to curl up on the couch beside you.

Lexi has soft, silky golden fur that softens her already gentle appearance. She has big, brown eyes and a contagious smile. She's built like your average Golden, but she's gotten heavier over the years, and while she isn't huge, her big, soft tummy definitely tells of her success convincing others that she could use just one more treat. And maybe another. And maybe that one, too...

Lexi really likes to eat, and will try her best to convince you to give her as many treats as she can. Her soft eyes have served to soften her belly over time, and she's not shy about asking for another treat, even if she's already had five. Keep her out of the kitchen when you aren't home, though, cause this gal will find a way to food if she thinks getting in trouble later will be worth getting at the food now.
1211.title: Golden Retriever

1212.content:
Sophie is a spry and energetic one year-old German Shepherd. This mischievous gal loves nothing more than to snuggle up on the couch and go for long walks through the park. Although she loves to romp about the backyard and chase after her frisbee, she also has a hard time saying no to table scraps slipped to her and savours the taste of that little bit of bacon grease atop her kibble.

Shasta is a mature black furred Shepherdess that is quite mellow in her cushy lifestyle. She's grown quite lazy as every whim of hers is attentended to, including breakfast, lunch, supper, and midnight snacks. Resulting in a rather soft paunch that is unlikely to disappear as she continues to lounge about, indulging in every taste and craving.
1212.title: German Shepherd

choices: "She's going on a diet with lots of exercise!"
12122.content:
"Has Shasta been following the diet plan we set up during our last visit?" The vet asked in a flat tone as he stared at me, unblinking, over top of his glasses. The middle aged, salt and pepper haired doctor had watched as I had casually strolled into the examining room with Shasta in tow. The four year old, black furred Shepherdess was energetic and happy as she wagged her tail and wriggled about, looking up at me with her soft brown eyes. I gulped nervously as I adjusted her bright pink bandanna across her thick neck, centering the triangle of fabric against her chest*

"Heh Heh...Of course!" I laughed nervously as I slowly knelt down and wrapped my arms around her waist. Her well-rounded, soft, and pudgy pot belly pressing against my arms as I strained to heave her up off the floor and lift her onto the examining table. I felt her tremendous bulk and heft against my body as I slowly stood back from the table. "She gets a quarter cup of food twice a day!" I said as I stood there, catching my breath as I stepped closer, stroking Shasta's big ears*

"And she get's no table scraps or extra treats?" The vet asked with a hint of skepticism as he poked and prodded at the Shepherdess' broad back, thick haunches, and her prominent bloated pot belly. He was no doubt scanning her last annual check up on his clip board, looking for faults in my answers"

"I think she's put on a bit of weight over the winter." He said matter-of-factually as he tapped his pen on the clipboard. "Her weight-in last year was 65lbs and now she's tipping the scales at 175lbs!" He said with a frown as he stared at me unblinking.

"She needs a drastic change in her diet right now!" He said as wrote furiously atop this clipboard, ignoring me as he continued to scribble.

What did her prescribe? :
12122.title: Shasta

choices: A food truck parked at the street corner. "You like Chinese food, right?"
At the pet shop. "We have to pick up your new food, remember?"
121222.content:
The tension mounted inside the examination room as the vet spoke to me with much distain "This excess weight is detrimental to her health and well being!" The vet continued as he scribbled on his clipboard, looking up at me as he frowned.

"All this extra weight is no doubt putting stress on her legs, joints, and back! If you don't cut back on her food soon, the results may be hard to reverse..." He trailed off as he verified her weight on the scale beside the table and looked over Shasta once more. Seemingly oblivious to how my stunningly beautiful black furred Shepherdess was wriggling and wigging about atop the table with ease of motion. Dipping and and bending her back in a play bow as she wagged her tail, her tongue rolling out of her muzzle as she smiled at me.

"I'm doing this in the best interest of Shasta and I hope you'll take my advice seriously" He said as he handed me the sheet of paper off the clipboard, now filled out.

"I recommend that you immediately stop with the treats and table scraps, cut back on her food to one quarter of a cup of food per day and be sure to purchase the obesity maintenance dog food that I have written down, and most importantly, I want to see her back in three months time and much lighter!"

With the slip of paper in my hand, I watched as the veterinarian nodded curtly at me and Shasta and promptly left the room. I looked to Shasta and shrugged meekly, the vet's verbal bashing had left me blushing brightly and rubbing the back of my neck nervously.

I gently tugged on her leash and watched as she gracefully leap off the table and rejoined me at my side as we slipped out of the vet clinic.

"Shasta, my darling, you got me in a lot of trouble today!" I said as I felt like scolding the fat bellied Shepherdess, but immediately lost my train of thought as she happily waddled alongside me, practically glued to my side as we walked together down the sidewalk, Shasta happily nuzzling and rubbing up against my leg as she smiled up at me with her big soft brown eyes, her tail wagging wildly as she bumped and licked at my hand.

Oh Sweetie! How could I blame you for being you? *I chuckled as we padded down the street together, rounding a corner and stopping, Shasta looking up at me with great curiosity.

Where are we?
121222.title: "No more treats and table scraps!"
